history.proof: unfold SF_lx. unfold SF_cons. simpl. reflexivity.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Type
h: (R * T)%type
s: SF_seq

Goal:
SF_lx (SF_cons h s) = fst h :: SF_lx s

Premises:
SF_lx = fun s : SF_seq => SF_h s :: unzip1 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq R
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
*** [ R : Set ]
SF_cons = fun (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) => {| SF_h := fst h; SF_t := (SF_h s, snd h) :: SF_t s |} : R * T -> SF_seq -> SF_seq
SF_cons_rcons : forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq) (l : R * T), SF_cons h (SF_rcons s l) = SF_rcons (SF_cons h s) l
unzip1_fst : forall s0 : seq (?S * ?T), unzip1 s0 = [seq fst i | i <- s0] where ?S : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type]
last_unzip1 : forall (x0 : ?S) (y0 : ?T) (s0 : seq (?S * ?T)), last x0 (unzip1 s0) = fst (last (x0, y0) s0) where ?S : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type]
SF_cons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
SF_lx_nil : forall x0 : R, SF_lx (SF_nil x0) = [:: x0]
SF_cons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (h : R * T) (s : SF_seq), P s -> P (SF_cons h s)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
unzip1_rcons : forall (s0 : seq (?S * ?T)) (h0 : ?S * ?T), unzip1 (rcons s0 h0) = rcons (unzip1 s0) (fst h0) where ?S : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type] ?T : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type]
Rlist2seq = fix Rlist2seq (s : Rlist) : seq R := match s with | nil => [::] | cons h t => h :: Rlist2seq t end : Rlist -> seq R
SF_seq_bij_lx : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T) (Hs : size lx = S (size ly)), SF_lx (SF_make lx ly Hs) = lx
SF_ly = fun s : SF_seq => unzip2 (SF_t s) : SF_seq -> seq T
SF_rcons = fun (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T) => {| SF_h := SF_h s; SF_t := rcons (SF_t s) t |} : SF_seq -> R * T -> SF_seq
SF_t = fun s : SF_seq => let (_, SF_t) := s in SF_t : SF_seq -> seq (R * T)
rcons_dec : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type]
rcons_ind : forall P : seq ?T -> Type, P [::] -> (forall (s0 : seq ?T) (t : ?T), P s0 -> P (rcons s0 t)) -> forall s : seq ?T, P s where ?T : [T : Type h : R * T s : SF_seq |- Type]
zip_unzip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq (S * T)), zip (unzip1 s) (unzip2 s) = s
SF_seq_bij : forall s : SF_seq, SF_make (SF_lx s) (SF_ly s) (SF_size_lx_ly s) = s
Record SF_seq : Type := mkSF_seq { SF_h : R; SF_t : seq (R * T) } For mkSF_seq: Argument scopes are [R_scope seq_scope]
unzip1 = fun S T : Type => map fst : forall S T : Type, seq (S * T) -> seq S Arguments S, T are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope seq_scope]
SF_size_lx_ly : forall s : SF_seq, size (SF_lx s) = S (size (SF_ly s))
SF_h = fun s : SF_seq => let (SF_h, _) := s in SF_h : SF_seq -> R
size_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), size (zip s t) = ssrnat.minn (size s) (size t)
unzip1_zip : forall (S T : Type) (s : seq S) (t : seq T), ssrnat.leq (size s) (size t) -> unzip1 (zip s t) = s
zip = fun S T : Type => fix zip (s : seq S) (t : seq T) {struct t} : seq (S * T) := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => match t with | [::] => [::] | y :: t' => (x, y) :: zip s' t' end end : forall S T : Type, seq S -> seq T -> seq (S * T) Arguments S, T are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope seq_scope seq_scope]
mult_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x * f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
SF_make : forall (lx : seq R) (ly : seq T), size lx = S (size ly) -> SF_seq
SF_nil = fun x0 : R => {| SF_h := x0; SF_t := [::] |} : R -> SF_seq Argument scope is [R_scope]
Ring_polynom.MPcond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> seq (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> seq R -> Prop
rcons = fun T : Type => fix rcons (s : seq T) (z : T) {struct s} : seq T := match s with | [::] => [:: z] | x :: s' => x :: rcons s' z end : forall T : Type, seq T -> T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope _]
plus_fct = fun (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R) => f1 x + f2 x : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope Rfun_scope R_scope]
map = fun (T1 T2 : Type) (f : T1 -> T2) => fix map (s : seq T1) : seq T2 := match s with | [::] => [::] | x :: s' => f x :: map s' end : forall T1 T2 : Type, (T1 -> T2) -> seq T1 -> seq T2 Arguments T1, T2 are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope function_scope seq_scope]
antiderivative = fun (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) => (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> exists pr : derivable_pt g x, f x = derive_pt g x pr) /\ a <= b : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]
SF_rcons_dec : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
bound = fun E : R -> Prop => exists m : R, is_upper_bound E m : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
SF_rcons_ind : forall P : SF_seq -> Type, (forall x0 : R, P (SF_nil x0)) -> (forall (s : SF_seq) (t : R * T), P s -> P (SF_rcons s t)) -> forall s : SF_seq, P s
behead = fun (T : Type) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => [::] | _ :: s' => s' end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> seq R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
head = fun (T : Type) (x0 : T) (s : seq T) => match s with | [::] => x0 | x :: _ => x end : forall T : Type, T -> seq T -> T Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
size = fun T : Type => fix size (s : seq T) : nat := match s with | [::] => 0%nat | _ :: s' => S (size s') end : forall T : Type, seq T -> nat Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope seq_scope]
derivable_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => {l : R | derivable_pt_abs f x l} : (R -> R) -> R -> Set Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
derivable_pt_abs = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : R) => derivable_pt_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope R_scope]

```coq
unfold SF_lx. unfold SF_cons. simpl. reflexivity.
Qed.```
